findings.title: Low severity: Solidity style guide naming convention issues found
findings.description: The code does not conform to the Solidity styleguide.

findings.title: A floating pragma is set SWC-103:
findings.description: The current pragma Solidity directive is "^0.6.12". It is recommended to specify a fixed compiler version to ensure that the bytecode produced does not vary between builds.

findings.title: Requirement violation SWC-123
findings.description: The Solidity require() construct is meant to validate external inputs of a function.

findings.title: Assert violation SWC-110
findings.description: The Solidity assert() function is meant to assert invariants. Properly functioning code should _never_ reach a failing assert statement.

findings.title: Assertions and Property Checking: Solidity assert violation.
findings.description: The Solidity assert() function is meant to assert invariants. Properly functioning code should never reach a failing assert statement.

findings.title: Assertions and Property Checking: Solidity AssertionFailed event.
findings.description: The finding indicates a potential issue with assertions and property checking in the smart contract, specifically related to the Solidity AssertionFailed event.

findings.title: ERC Standards: Incorrect ERC20 implementation.
findings.description: The contract does not adhere to the ERC20 standard correctly.

findings.title: Solidity Coding Best Practices: Outdated compiler version
findings.description: The solidity versions used for the audited contracts are outdated and susceptible to known bugs such as EmptyByteArrayCopy and DynamicArrayCleanup.

findings.title: Solidity Coding Best Practices: No or floating compiler version set
findings.description: It's recommended to specify a fixed compiler version to ensure bytecode produced does not vary between builds.

findings.title: Solidity Coding Best Practices: Use of right-to-left-override control character
findings.description: The contract uses a right-to-left-override control character which can lead to code readability issues and potential security vulnerabilities.

findings.title: Shadowing of built-in symbol
findings.description: The usage of a built-in symbol as a variable name can lead to confusion and unexpected behavior.

findings.title: Solidity Coding Best Practices: Incorrect constructor name.
findings.description: The constructor of a contract has an incorrect or inconsistent naming convention.

findings.title: Solidity Coding Best Practices: State variable shadows another state variable
findings.description: State variable shadows another state variable which may cause confusion and unintended behavior.

findings.title: Solidity Coding Best Practices: Local variable shadows a state variable.
findings.description: The function uses a local variable with the same name as a state variable, which can lead to confusion and unintended behavior.

findings.title: Function parameter shadows a state variable
findings.description: In Solidity, a function parameter is shadowing a state variable which can lead to unexpected behavior and potential security vulnerabilities.

findings.title: Named return value shadows a state variable
findings.description: In Solidity coding best practices, named return values shadowing state variables can lead to unintended behavior and potential security vulnerabilities.

findings.title: Unary operation without effect
findings.description: The unary operation has no effect on the Solidity code.

findings.title: Unary operation directly after assignment
findings.description: Unary operations should not be performed immediately after an assignment to avoid potential issues with variable values.

findings.title: Solidity Coding Best Practices: Unused state variable
findings.description: Unused state variables can lead to unnecessary gas consumption and potential security vulnerabilities.

findings.title: Solidity Coding Best Practices: Unused local variable.
findings.description: The code contains an unused local variable, which can lead to unnecessary complexity and potential security risks.

findings.title: Function visibility is not set
findings.description: Function visibility is not explicitly defined.

findings.title: State variable visibility is not set
findings.description: The state variable's visibility is not explicitly defined, which can lead to unintended access and potential security risks.

findings.title: Solidity Coding Best Practices: Use of deprecated functions
findings.description: The contract uses deprecated functions such as call code(), sha3(), etc.

findings.title: Use of deprecated global variables
findings.description: The contract uses deprecated Solidity global variables such as msg.gas.

findings.title: Solidity Coding Best Practices: Use of deprecated keywords (throw, var)
findings.description: The contract uses deprecated Solidity keywords 'throw' and 'var', which can lead to compatibility issues and potential security vulnerabilities.

findings.title: Solidity Coding Best Practices: Incorrect function state mutability
findings.description: Incorrect function state mutability can lead to unintended behavior and potential security risks.

findings.title: Solidity Coding Best Practices: Does the code conform to the Solidity styleguide
findings.description: The code does not follow the recommended naming conventions and best practices as per the Solidity style guide.

findings.title: Non-Conforming Solidity Styleguide
findings.description: The code does not conform to the Solidity style guide.
